newsitem.title: USA: Swiss Army alleges trademark infringement.
newsitem.headline: Swiss Army alleges trademark infringement.

text.p: Swiss Army Brands Inc., which markets Swiss Army knives and watches, said Wednesday it sued Price/Costco Inc., alleging trademark infringement and unfair competition.

The lawsuit, filed on Monday in federal court in New York, seeks to prevent Price/Costco from using its name in any manner that implies Swiss Army Brands is a direct source of products for Price/Costco stores.

The lawsuit charged that Price/Costco's use of the Swiss Army trademark misleads consumers into believing the retail chain had an authorised association with goods bearing the Swiss Army name, the Shelton, Conn.-based company said.
Swiss Army said it also wanted the court to stop the retailer from using the term "Swiss Army" in connection with watches made or distributed without its authorisation.
It alleged that Price/Costco has falsely represented on the Internet and in the New York area that Swiss Army was a vendor company of Price/Costco.
Price/Costco, based in Issaquah, Wash., was not immediately available to comment on the lawsuit.
Swiss Army Brands, formerly The Forschner Group Inc., is the exclusive U.S., Canadian and Caribbean marketer of Victorinox Original Swiss Army Knives, Swiss Army Brand watches and other products.
